docs.lead_paragraph: The findings by researchers at Harvard Medical School go against the notion that immigrants are a drain on federal health care spending.

headline.main: For Medicare, Immigrants Offer Surplus, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: For Medicare, Immigrants Offer Surplus, Study Finds

docs.abstract: Harvard Medical School study published in journal Health Affairs finds that immigrants have contributed billions of dollars more to Medicare in recent years than the program has paid out on their behalf, pattern that goes against notion that immigrants are a drain on federal health care spending.
docs.snippet: The findings by researchers at Harvard Medical School go against the notion that immigrants are a drain on federal health care spending.
